result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian A. Maier

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:07 AM Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Brian A. Maier.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization to be filed later today.
Defense is waiting for a global offer.
State has offer in the file and will forward it.
Defense requests plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

9:26 AM Defendant Brian A. Maier in court.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Brian A. Maier.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for bail/bond hearing.
Arguments by the Defense.  
Objections by the State.
Court grants motion and orders conditions of bond modified to remove the CAM monitoring condition.
Hearing set for 9/28/22 to remain on the Court's calendar as previously scheduled.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing on September 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Motion for Bail Modification, filed by Atty. Wolff

9:17 AM Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian A. Maier in court.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Brian A. Maier. 
Case called for jury status hearing in 21CM1582.
Attorney Wolff advises he has not been appointed to the 22CM1215 matter yet.
Defendant sworn in and testified.  
Court orders the appointment of counsel in 21CM1582 extended to 22CM1215.
Defendant to pay an additional $25.00 per month commencing on 9/1/22 to bring his payment amount between the 2 cases to $75.00 per month.
Defense requests an adjournment of the trial to seek a global resolution.
Court will remove the jury trial set for 8/30/22 and set both matters for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Letter from C.C.re: Defendant

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on August 17, 2022 - Review in Court.**

Apply cash bail previously posted and refund balance to the poster.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  Defendant to report to WCS immediately after Court today.

10:15 AM Defendant Brian A. Maier in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  The Court notes Attorney Peter Wolff currently represents the defendant on his other matter and will extend Attorney Peter Wolff's appointment to this matter.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on July 13, 2022.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
